title: Electric PE - three point charges Q Q and -2Q

content.question: Two different systems, each having three point charges, are shown in the figure. Each system has a negative point charge <math alttext="negative 2 uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> and two positive point charges, each with charge <math alttext="positive uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>. In System <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, the point charges are arranged along a straight line with each positive point charge at a distance <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math> from the negative point charge. In System <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, the point charge arrangement forms an equilateral triangle of side length <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the electric potential energies <math alttext="U sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="U sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math> of the two systems? Take the potential energy of each system to be zero when the point charges are infinitely far apart from one another.
